inference:
Let \(z^\circ\) be the angle \(BAx\). Then the sum of \(z^\circ\), \(z^\circ\) and \(52^\circ\) is \(x^\circ\), so

$$2z^\circ + 52^\circ = x^\circ$$

Since \(AB\) and \(Ax\) are opposite rays, \(z^\circ\) is supplementary to \(x^\circ\), so

$$z^\circ = 180^\circ - x^\circ$$

Substituting this into the first equation, we get

$$\begin{split} 2(180^\circ - x^\circ) + 52^\circ &= x^\circ \\\ 360^\circ - 4x^\circ + 52^\circ &= x^\circ \\\ -5x^\circ &= -308^\circ \\\ x\circ &= 61.6^\circ \end{split}$$
Final Answer: $\boxed{61.6^\circ}$. I hope it is correct.

question:
Let \(z^\circ\) be the angle \(BAx\). Then the sum of \(z^\circ\), \(z^\circ\) and \(52^\circ\) is \(x^\circ\), so

$$2z^\circ + 52^\circ = x^\circ$$

Since \(AB\) and \(Ax\) are opposite rays, \(z^\circ\) is supplementary to \(x^\circ\), so

$$z^\circ = 180^\circ - x^\circ$$

Substituting this into the first equation, we get

$$\begin{split} 2(180^\circ - x^\circ) + 52^\circ &= x^\circ \\\ 360^\circ - 4x^\circ + 52^\circ &= x^\circ \\\ -5x^\circ &= -308^\circ \\\ x\circ &= 61.6^\circ \end{split}$$
Final Answer: $\boxed{61.6^\circ}$. I hope it is correct.
